Package com.atakmap.android.maps.tilesets.mobac

Class WMSQueryLayers

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.android.maps.tilesets.mobac.QueryLayers
      • com.atakmap.android.maps.tilesets.mobac.WMSQueryLayers
  • public class WMSQueryLayers
extends QueryLayers

    Concrete class extending the QueryLayers abstract class, providing an implementation for querying a WMS server's GetCapabilities operation.

    WMS layers may form a tree structure. Non-leaf nodes may be displayable as layers in their own right, or not. The layer metadata this class provides is returned in a recursive structure to represent that tree. The Layer.isDisplayable() method may be called to determine if a layer is a displayable layer, rather than just a "container" layer.

    The WMS specification can be found here: http://cite.opengeospatial.org/teamengine/about/wms/1.1.1/site/ and http://cite.opengeospatial.org/teamengine/about/wms/1.3.0/site/

    • Constructor Detail

      • WMSQueryLayers

        public WMSQueryLayers​(java.lang.String baseURLStr)

        Create a new WMSQueryLayers object with the given URL string that points to a WMS server. baseURLStr may be missing the protocol, in which case HTTP is assumed and "http://" will be pre-pended to the URL string.

        No processing or network access is done at this time except for URL syntax validation; process() must be called to actually query the WMS.
        Parameters:
        baseURLStr - the URL of the WMS server.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if baseURLStr is not a valid URL, the above protocol exception notwithstanding.

      • WMSQueryLayers

        public WMSQueryLayers​(java.net.URL baseURL)

        Create a new WMSQueryLayers object with the given URL that points to a WMS server.

        No processing or network access is done at this time except for URL syntax validation; process() must be called to actually query the WMS.
        Parameters:
        baseURL - the URL of the WMS server.

      • process

        public void process()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: QueryLayers
        Actually perform the query of the map server. An exception will be thrown in case of any failure. This function performs network access.
        Specified by:
        process in class QueryLayers
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of error.

      • constructAggregate

        public static WebMapLayer constructAggregate​(java.lang.String title,
                                             java.util.List<WebMapLayer> layers)
        Responsible for producing an aggregate WebMapLayer Tested with: https://geoint.nrlssc.navy.mil/maritime/wms?REQUEST=GetCapabilities&VERSION=1.3.0&SERVICE=WMS
        Parameters:
        title - supplied title for the aggregrate.
        layers - the layers to aggregate together.
